text: Archibald Cunningham (30 April 1879 – 18 March 1915) was a Scottish professional football goalkeeper who played in the Scottish League for Leith Athletic. == Personal life == Cunningham was born in Lasswade and worked as a miner at the Woolmet Pits. He enlisted as a private in the Highland Light Infantry in September 1914, shortly after the First World War broke out. Cunningham was killed in France on 18 March 1915 after the Battle of Neuve Chapelle and is commemorated on the Le Touret Memorial. ==References== Category:1879 births Category:1915 deaths Category:Scottish footballers Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:Leith Athletic F.C. players Category:Scottish Football League players Category:British Army personnel of World War I Category:British military personnel killed in World War I Category:Highland Light Infantry soldiers Category:Glentoran F.C. players Category:NIFL Premiership players
title: Archibald Cunningham
